org.s2doglm.vector

Class Vec4

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.s2doglm.vector.Vec4

  • public class Vec4
extends java.lang.Object

    S2DOGLM - Simple 2D OpenGL Matrix

    About S2DOGLM

    Created to help me use matrix for 2D OpenGL.
    Containing several simple functions which doesn't contain anything related to Z axis.
    Or at least for now..

    About this class

    Contain several simple functions such as creating vector and transforming a vector with a transformation matrix.

    Author:
    Greffin28
    See Also:
    org.s2doglm.matrix.Matrix Matrix}

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Vec4()
      Calling Vec4() as a constructor will create a vector with the following coordinates:
      x = 0.0f;
      y = 0.0f;
      z = 0.0f;
      w = 1.0f;
      Vec4(float x, float y)
      Calling Vec4(float x, float y) as a constructor will create a vector with the given x and y.
      z = 0.0f;
      w = 1.0f;

      Vec4(float x, float y, float z)
      Calling Vec4(float x, float y, float z) as a constructor will create a vector with the given x, y, and z.
      w = 1.0f

      This function is the only one that use Z axis.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float[] getVector()
      Used to get the current vector values as a float array.
      java.nio.FloatBuffer getVectorBuffer()
      Used to get the current vector values as a FloatBuffer.
      void printVector()
      Used to simply print the vector values to the console.
      void transform(Matrix mat)
      Used to transform the current vector by multiplying a transformation matrix with the current vector itself.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Vec4

        public Vec4(float x,
            float y)
        Calling Vec4(float x, float y) as a constructor will create a vector with the given x and y.
        z = 0.0f;
        w = 1.0f;

        Parameters:
        x - Horizontal coordinate.
        y - Vertical coordinate.

      • Vec4

        public Vec4(float x,
            float y,
            float z)
        Calling Vec4(float x, float y, float z) as a constructor will create a vector with the given x, y, and z.
        w = 1.0f

        This function is the only one that use Z axis.

        Parameters:
        x - Horizontal coordinate.
        y - Vertical coordinate.
        z - -

    • Method Detail

      • transform

        public void transform(Matrix mat)
        Used to transform the current vector by multiplying a transformation matrix with the current vector itself.

        Parameters:
        mat - Matrix that will be multiplied by the current vector.

      • getVectorBuffer

        public java.nio.FloatBuffer getVectorBuffer()
        Used to get the current vector values as a FloatBuffer.
